Buzzer.label: Buzzer
Buzzer.description: This IPSO object should be used to actuate an audible alarm such as a buzzer, beeper, or vibration alarm. There is a dimmer control for setting the relative level of the alarm, and an optional duration control to limit the length of time the alarm sounds when turned on. Each time "true" is written to the On/Off resource, the alarm will sound again for the configured duration. If no duration is programmed or the setting is "false", writing a "true" to the On/Off resource will result in the alarm sounding continuously until a "false" is written to the On/Off resource.

On_Off.label: On/Off
On_Off.description: On/off control. Boolean value where True is On and False is Off.

Level.label: Level
Level.description: Used to represent a level control such as audio volume.

Delay_Duration.label: Delay Duration
Delay_Duration.description: The duration of the time delay.

Minimum_Off-time.label: Minimum Off-time
Minimum_Off-time.description: The duration of the rearm delay (i.e. the delay from the end of one cycle until the beginning of the next, the inhibit time).

Application_Type.label: Application Type
Application_Type.description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string depending on the use case.

Timestamp.label: Timestamp
Timestamp.description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed.

Fractional_Timestamp.label: Fractional Timestamp
Fractional_Timestamp.description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms).
